climbs.name: Straight Street
climbs.fa: R. Cotman, G. Briody, V. Kramar 2001

content.description:
P1.  Face climb between the blunt arete and a wide, highly vegetated crack to the left.  After 45 feet, the difficulty increases as you gain an inside corner.  Climb the dihedral to an impossibly smooth crux section.  A nicely placed bolt makes this challenging move less desperate, followed by easier climbing to the anchor. (5.9, 100')

P2.  The second pitch flirts with exposure as you follow bolts up the edge of the arete to a diaganol crack that gains a vertical left facing corner.  From the top of the corner, finish with an exposed and exhilarating undercling to the left. (5.8, 80')
content.protection:
P1-- 10 bolts.

P2-- bolts plus gear to 2".  Purple to red camalots (0.5-1") protect the final undercling; be mindful of the potential swing back into the corner.
content.location: Leftmost bolted route at Off Duty Area. Starts by a few trees. A 60-m rope is required to rap from the top of P1.

climbs.name: Slap
climbs.fa: D. Bale, G. Briody, V. Kramar 2002

content.description: This line is the furthest right at Off Duty.  Edge past bolts to a wide, broken corner formed by a large flake.  Near the top of the flake, make a tricky move left to gain a small dihedral.  Smear and edge to the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts.  An easy but substantial runout between the 3rd and 4th bolts could be protected with a hand-sized piece to guard against a potential ground fall.

content.description: Bolted slab right of the crack splitting the face.  Many good positive holds.
content.protection: 6 bolts, 1 finger-sized piece may help. rap station
content.location: Starts just left of Off Duty and under the big roof. Start going left off a rock pedestal. End just below the crux bulge of Lee's Crack.

climbs.name: Off Duty
climbs.fa: D. Lenz, A. Kramar, V. Kramar, J. Halley 1988

content.description: Classic Icicle slab climbing. Begin from the top of the small tower at the base of Off Duty.  Edge past bolts, then work left before heading up and right to a comfortable stance on the right side of the small roof band.  Work left to get established above the roof, then chase small edges the anchor.
content.protection: Bolts.  The runout after the 5th bolt can be protected with a small cam (fingers).  Lowering uses every inch of a 60m rope.  Clean some draws as you descend to gain some length.
content.location:
Right side, under the Gumball Roof

Starts off the highest Rock pedestal, directly under a midwall tree.

content.description:
Tackle a few steep moves through the roof directly up and right of the anchor for "peckin' time". After this trend right on an intermittent mid 5th crack to the higher anchor above "off duty".

A forewarning, it's actually a block you'll be pulling on to make the roof. It seemed quite bomber, but I still didn't put a cam near the top of it.
content.protection: Light rack to 2". No finger size gear needed.
content.location: Directly above peckin' time and easily seen from the base.

content.description: Stemming and liebacking in a nice right facing corner. Awkward to place gear at the crux.
content.location: RFC on the far left side of the crag. Several trees near the base.

climbs.name: Aquamarine
climbs.fa: Dave Bale, Viktor Kramer, Gordon Briody

content.description: A short 1st pitch is bolt protected (30ft).  The 2nd pitch continues left then up the slab passing small overlaps and ending just below Gumball Roof.

climbs.name: A Shade of Jade
climbs.fa: Sean Woods, Viktor Kramer, Gordon Briody 2009

content.description: Move left after the Peckin Time anchors to a difficult move around the roof.  Once you master the difficult foot work and body position after the roof, proceed through sustained slab to a bolt anchor.  A couple medium cams are helpful but its safe with bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts, a couple medium cams are helpful. Anchor bolts.
content.location: Continue left after the Peckin Time anchors

pathTokens: Duty Dome - Warrior Wall - Peek-a-boo Area
